intro: Glechoma luchuensis, commonly known as the Luchuan deadnettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Glechoma luchuensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
